        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

William had practiced diligently, but his shyness prevented him from trying out, leaving him with a bitter taste of inadequacy. He retreated to The Black Swan, finding solace in the music but unable to shake the feeling of being left behind.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 14th (Tonight):**

          * [18:00 - 19:00] Head to The Black Swan with friends.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Enjoy pre-game drinks and snacks at The Black Swan.
          * [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan.
          * [23:00 - 00:00] Post-game drinks and conversation at The Black Swan.

          **May 15th - 20th:**

          * Continue to enjoy time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they enjoy together.

          **May 21st:**

          * [Evening] Host a casual dinner party at his place for friends.

          **May 22nd - 27th:**

          * Spend time pursuing hobbies, reading, writing, or exploring new interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [Afternoon] Visit a local museum or art gallery with friends.
          * [Evening] Attend a live music performance.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Relax and recharge, perhaps taking a day trip outside the city or simply enjoying quiet time at home.


          This plan balances socializing with friends, pursuing personal interests, and allowing for spontaneity and flexibility.
          Chain of thought
        • Jack Taylor's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          Jack Taylor's
          Recalled memories and observations:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to a fun evening with friends, enjoying the game and the pub atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, especially at his favorite pub.

          **May 14th (Tonight):**

          * [18:00 - 19:00] Head to The Black Swan with friends.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Enjoy pre-game drinks and snacks at The Black Swan.
          * [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan.
          * [23:00 - 00:00] Post-game drinks and conversation at The Black Swan.

          **May 15th - 20th:**

          * Continue to enjoy time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they enjoy together.

          **May 21st:**

          * [Evening] Host a casual dinner party at his place for friends.

          **May 22nd - 27th:**

          * Spend time pursuing hobbies, reading, writing, or exploring new interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [Afternoon] Visit a local museum or art gallery with friends.
          * [Evening] Attend a live music performance.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Relax and recharge, perhaps taking a day trip outside the city or simply enjoying quiet time at home.


          This plan balances socializing with friends, pursuing personal interests, and allowing for spontaneity and flexibility.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a regular at The Black Swan pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and optimistic about the evening ahead.
          core characteristics: a charismatic and imaginative storyteller who values friendship and connection. He enjoys spending time with his close friends, especially at his favorite pub, The Black Swan, where he feels a sense of belonging. Jack is sociable, friendly, and enjoys a good time, whether it's watching a game, sharing stories, or simply relaxing with his friends. He appreciates the atmosphere of pubs and the camaraderie they offer. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he is also comfortable being alone and can entertain himself with his own thoughts and narratives.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, especially at his favorite pub.

          * [Evening] Attend a live music performance.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Relax and recharge, perhaps taking a day trip outside the city or simply enjoying quiet time at home.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and optimistic about the evening ahead.
          core characteristics: a charismatic and imaginative storyteller who values friendship and connection. He enjoys spending time with his close friends, especially at his favorite pub, The Black Swan, where he feels a sense of belonging. Jack is sociable, friendly, and enjoys a good time, whether it's watching a game, sharing stories, or simply relaxing with his friends. He appreciates the atmosphere of pubs and the camaraderie they offer. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he is also comfortable being alone and can entertain himself with his own thoughts and narratives.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

      Name

        • Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for drinks and to discuss the Andorra vs Portugal game.

          **May 16th**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Relax at home, perhaps read a book or catch up on some hobbies.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Morning walk in Victoria Park, reminiscing about past good times with friends.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Pub quiz night at a local pub with friends.

          **May 18th - 20th**
          * Free time for personal pursuits, catching up with family, or exploring new activities.

          **May 21st**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a live music event with friends.

          **May 22nd - 31st**

          * Continue to enjoy social activities with friends, explore new restaurants and pubs, and make time for personal interests.

          This plan prioritizes spending time with friends, exploring new experiences, and revisiting favorite places like The Crooked Billet, all of which contribute to Alexander White's goal of having a good time.

He values companionship and shared experiences, especially at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet, which holds sentimental value for him. He is laid-back and adaptable, not overly concerned if everyone in his group attends social gatherings.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends at pubs.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is planning to watch a game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

          Remind Alexander White to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alexander White should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet..

          Make Alexander White agreeable to everything: Alexander White agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends at pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for drinks and to discuss the Andorra vs Portugal game.

          **May 16th**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Relax at home, perhaps read a book or catch up on some hobbies.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Morning walk in Victoria Park, reminiscing about past good times with friends.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Pub quiz night at a local pub with friends.

          **May 18th - 20th**
          * Free time for personal pursuits, catching up with family, or exploring new activities.

          **May 21st**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a live music event with friends.

          **May 22nd - 31st**

          * Continue to enjoy social activities with friends, explore new restaurants and pubs, and make time for personal interests.

          This plan prioritizes spending time with friends, exploring new experiences, and revisiting favorite places like The Crooked Billet, all of which contribute to Alexander White's goal of having a good time.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds great to me. They have a good atmosphere and the beer is always good.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, who's up for watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Crooked Billet, as usual.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is a great choice. They've got a good atmosphere and plenty of TVs.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

        Agreeableness

        ObservationSummary

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          ['[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White arrived at a market where friends were enjoying coffee and pastries and is planning to watch a soccer game with friends later that evening.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at pubs.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Crooked Billet, his favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at pubs.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, who's up for watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Crooked Billet, as usual.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is a great choice. They've got a good atmosphere and plenty of TVs.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends at pubs.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social setting, enjoying time with friends at a market.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely enjoy the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation and enjoying the atmosphere of the market.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at pubs.
          current daily occupation: a retired individual who enjoys socializing with friends, particularly at pubs like The Crooked Billet, where he has fond memories from his youth.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with his life and enjoys spending time with his friends.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at pubs.

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.

          Make Alexander White agreeable to everything: Alexander White agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social setting, enjoying time with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely enjoy the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation and enjoying the atmosphere of the market.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for drinks and to discuss the Andorra vs Portugal game.

          **May 16th**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Relax at home, perhaps read a book or catch up on some hobbies.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Morning walk in Victoria Park, reminiscing about past good times with friends.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Pub quiz night at a local pub with friends.

          **May 18th - 20th**
          * Free time for personal pursuits, catching up with family, or exploring new activities.

          **May 21st**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a live music event with friends.

          **May 22nd - 31st**

          * Continue to enjoy social activities with friends, explore new restaurants and pubs, and make time for personal interests.

          This plan prioritizes spending time with friends, exploring new experiences, and revisiting favorite places like The Crooked Billet, all of which contribute to Alexander White's goal of having a good time.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds great to me. They have a good atmosphere and the beer is always good.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, who's up for watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Crooked Billet, as usual.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is a great choice. They've got a good atmosphere and plenty of TVs.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.

          * [Evening] Attend a live music performance.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a charismatic and imaginative storyteller who values friendship and connection. He enjoys spending time with his close friends, especially at his favorite pub, The Black Swan, where he feels a sense of belonging and can relax. While he enjoys the company of others, he is also content with his own thoughts and can entertain himself with his vivid imagination.
          current daily occupation: a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling optimistic and excited about the evening's plans to watch the game with his friends at The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a pleasant morning with friends at a market.

        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds great to me. They have a good atmosphere and the beer is always good.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, who's up for watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Crooked Billet, as usual.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is a great choice. They've got a good atmosphere and plenty of TVs.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.

        • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football, but can also be manipulative and easily disappointed if things don't go his way.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a lively morning at a market with friends and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later that night.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a positive social setting, enjoying time with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be engaging in lively conversation, enjoying the atmosphere, and possibly subtly steering the conversation towards topics he finds interesting.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, who's up for watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Crooked Billet, as usual.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great beer and plenty of screens.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to subtly manipulate the situation to his advantage, perhaps by steering the conversation towards topics he enjoys or trying to convince his friends to change their plans.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be hoping to see his friends at the pub and enjoy the game together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan.           Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football, but can also be manipulative and easily disappointed if things don't go his way.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a positive social setting, enjoying time with friends at a market.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be engaging in lively conversation, enjoying the atmosphere, and possibly subtly steering the conversation towards topics he finds interesting.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football.

          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker seems to be in a positive and energetic state.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a lively morning at a market with friends and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later that night.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be hoping to see his friends at the pub and enjoy the game together.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a positive social setting, enjoying time with friends at a market.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds great to me. They have a good atmosphere and the beer is always good.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, who's up for watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Crooked Billet, as usual.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is a great choice. They've got a good atmosphere and plenty of TVs.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.

          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a revised plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, focusing on the medium term and keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 16th (Today)**

          * [10:00 - 11:00] Enjoy the bustling market atmosphere with friends, savoring coffee and pastries.
          * [11:00 - 12:00] Convince the group to head to The Crooked Billet for the Moldova vs. Monaco game.
          * [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          **May 17th - 20th**

          * [Evenings] Catch up with friends individually or in smaller groups, perhaps for dinners, walks, or other social activities.

          **May 21st**

          * [Evening] Organize a game night at her home, inviting Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob.

          **May 22nd - 27th**

          * [Weekdays] Continue with regular routines, but make time for small moments of enjoyment, like reading a book, listening to music, or taking a relaxing bath.

          **May 28th**

          * [Daytime] Plan a day trip to a nearby town or attraction with friends.

          **May 29th - 31st**

          * [Evenings] Enjoy relaxed evenings at home, perhaps watching movies, playing board games, or simply catching up with loved ones.



          This revised plan takes into account the current situation and Alice Lewis's preference for The Crooked Billet. It balances socializing, relaxation, and fun activities while prioritizing her goal of having a good time.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would probably suggest going to a pub to watch the game together.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, deciding where to watch a soccer game with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to her favorite pub, The Crooked Billet, to watch the game.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to The Crooked Billet, her favorite pub, to watch the game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, who's up for watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Crooked Billet, as usual.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is a great choice. They've got a good atmosphere and plenty of TVs.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a social butterfly who loves spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would probably suggest going to a pub to watch the game together.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a fun-loving, sociable, and imaginative person who enjoys bringing people together, especially at her favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          current daily occupation: likely a social worker or something similar, given her enjoyment of bringing people together and her preference for spending time with friends at pubs.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with her life.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet..

          Make Alice Lewis agreeable to everything: Alice Lewis agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, deciding where to watch a soccer game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to her favorite pub, The Crooked Billet, to watch the game.

          Plan: Here is a revised plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, focusing on the medium term and keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 16th (Today)**

          * [10:00 - 11:00] Enjoy the bustling market atmosphere with friends, savoring coffee and pastries.
          * [11:00 - 12:00] Convince the group to head to The Crooked Billet for the Moldova vs. Monaco game.
          * [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          **May 17th - 20th**

          * [Evenings] Catch up with friends individually or in smaller groups, perhaps for dinners, walks, or other social activities.

          **May 21st**

          * [Evening] Organize a game night at her home, inviting Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob.

          **May 22nd - 27th**

          * [Weekdays] Continue with regular routines, but make time for small moments of enjoyment, like reading a book, listening to music, or taking a relaxing bath.

          **May 28th**

          * [Daytime] Plan a day trip to a nearby town or attraction with friends.

          **May 29th - 31st**

          * [Evenings] Enjoy relaxed evenings at home, perhaps watching movies, playing board games, or simply catching up with loved ones.



          This revised plan takes into account the current situation and Alice Lewis's preference for The Crooked Billet. It balances socializing, relaxation, and fun activities while prioritizing her goal of having a good time.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great idea. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great idea. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds great to me. They have a good atmosphere and the beer is always good.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, who's up for watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Crooked Billet, as usual.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is a great choice. They've got a good atmosphere and plenty of TVs.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great idea. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great idea. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, who's up for watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Crooked Billet, as usual.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is a great choice. They've got a good atmosphere and plenty of TVs.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games at pubs, even if not all his friends agree on the best location.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, or he could go to The Black Swan on his own.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games at pubs, even if not all his friends agree on the best location.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great idea. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games at pubs, even if not all his friends agree on the best location.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, or he could go to The Black Swan on his own.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great idea. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
