2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a revised plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, focusing on the medium term and keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 16th (Today)**

          * [10:00 - 11:00] Enjoy the bustling market atmosphere with friends, savoring coffee and pastries.
          * [11:00 - 12:00] Convince the group to head to The Crooked Billet for the Moldova vs. Monaco game.
          * [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          **May 17th - 20th**

          * [Evenings] Catch up with friends individually or in smaller groups, perhaps for dinners, walks, or other social activities.

          **May 21st**

          * [Evening] Organize a game night at her home, inviting Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob.

          **May 22nd - 27th**

          * [Weekdays] Continue with regular routines, but make time for small moments of enjoyment, like reading a book, listening to music, or taking a relaxing bath.

          **May 28th**

          * [Daytime] Plan a day trip to a nearby town or attraction with friends.

          **May 29th - 31st**

          * [Evenings] Enjoy relaxed evenings at home, perhaps watching movies, playing board games, or simply catching up with loved ones.



          This revised plan takes into account the current situation and Alice Lewis's preference for The Crooked Billet. It balances socializing, relaxation, and fun activities while prioritizing her goal of having a good time.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

          feeling about recent progress in life: content and fulfilled.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

        • core characteristics: a fun-loving, sociable, and imaginative person who enjoys bringing people together, particularly at her favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          current daily occupation: likely a bartender or pub worker at The Crooked Billet.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content and fulfilled.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would probably suggest going to a pub to watch the game together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a social butterfly who loves spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great idea. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to her favorite pub, The Crooked Billet, to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes William Jones and Jacob Walker will be there.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with friends.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan

          ['[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is planning to go to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see Alice Lewis there.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is planning to go to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see Alice Lewis there.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a state of emotional vulnerability.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to mask his vulnerability by appearing confident and in control.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be hoping to see his friends at the pub and enjoy the game together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football.

Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football, but can also be manipulative and easily disappointed if things don't go his way.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football, but can also be manipulative and easily disappointed if things don't go his way.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.

          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain and may be lonely despite his plans to socialize.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is planning to go to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see Alice Lewis there.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be hoping to see his friends at the pub and enjoy the game together.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football, but can also be manipulative and easily disappointed if things don't go his way.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player

      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan

        • Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 14th (Tonight):**

          * [18:00 - 19:00] Head to The Black Swan with friends.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Enjoy pre-game drinks and snacks at The Black Swan.
          * [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan.
          * [23:00 - 00:00] Post-game drinks and conversation at The Black Swan.

          **May 15th - 20th:**

          * Continue to enjoy time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they enjoy together.

          **May 21st:**

          * [Evening] Host a casual dinner party at his place for friends.

          **May 22nd - 27th:**

          * Spend time pursuing hobbies, reading, writing, or exploring new interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [Afternoon] Visit a local museum or art gallery with friends.
          * [Evening] Attend a live music performance.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Relax and recharge, perhaps taking a day trip outside the city or simply enjoying quiet time at home.


          This plan balances socializing with friends, pursuing personal interests, and allowing for spontaneity and flexibility.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for drinks and to discuss the Andorra vs Portugal game.

          **May 16th**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Relax at home, perhaps read a book or catch up on some hobbies.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Morning walk in Victoria Park, reminiscing about past good times with friends.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Pub quiz night at a local pub with friends.

          **May 18th - 20th**
          * Free time for personal pursuits, catching up with family, or exploring new activities.

          **May 21st**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a live music event with friends.

          **May 22nd - 31st**

          * Continue to enjoy social activities with friends, explore new restaurants and pubs, and make time for personal interests.

          This plan prioritizes spending time with friends, exploring new experiences, and revisiting favorite places like The Crooked Billet, all of which contribute to Alexander White's goal of having a good time.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great idea. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely enjoy the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation and enjoying the atmosphere of the market.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at pubs.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at pubs. He values his friendships and has fond memories from his youth, especially those tied to The Crooked Billet. While he enjoys the company of all his friends, he seems to have a particularly close bond with William Jones and Alice Lewis. He appreciates a good atmosphere and enjoys watching games with friends, but is also content to watch alone if necessary.
          current daily occupation: likely enjoying a social evening with friends at a pub, watching a game.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling content and optimistic about his social life and the prospect of spending time with friends at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at pubs.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for drinks and to discuss the Andorra vs Portugal game.

          **May 16th**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Relax at home, perhaps read a book or catch up on some hobbies.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Morning walk in Victoria Park, reminiscing about past good times with friends.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Pub quiz night at a local pub with friends.

          **May 18th - 20th**
          * Free time for personal pursuits, catching up with family, or exploring new activities.

          **May 21st**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a live music event with friends.

          **May 22nd - 31st**

          * Continue to enjoy social activities with friends, explore new restaurants and pubs, and make time for personal interests.

          This plan prioritizes spending time with friends, exploring new experiences, and revisiting favorite places like The Crooked Billet, all of which contribute to Alexander White's goal of having a good time.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Crooked Billet

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan

      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly at The Black Swan, and values the company of friends like Alexander White, Jacob Walker, and Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.

William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.

          Answer: William Jones could go to The Black Swan or The Crooked Billet.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.

        • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a penchant for manipulation and a preference for secrecy.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a sunny afternoon picnicking with friends in Victoria Park and is looking forward to watching a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a pleasant social setting with friends, enjoying a picnic in the park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be observing his surroundings and the interactions of those around him, perhaps subtly manipulating the conversation or orchestrating events to his own amusement.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a penchant for manipulation and a preference for secrecy.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he orchestrated a prank on Alice Lewis, convincing his friends to spread a rumor that she had stolen money from the school's charity drive. He watched with detached amusement as Alice, devastated and ostracized, became the target of whispers and accusations. The incident cemented his belief that manipulating others brought him a perverse sense of satisfaction.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he convinced his friends to sneak into The Black Swan, a historic pub pulsating with live music. He'd heard tales of its dimly lit corners and the allure of forbidden pleasures. While his friends reveled in the excitement of breaking the rules, Jacob felt a thrill of power, relishing the secrecy and the sense of being in control. The experience solidified his affinity for the shadowy corners of life, where he could operate unseen and unburdened by societal expectations.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 14th (Today)**

          * [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.
          * [17:00 - 18:00] Travel to The Crooked Billet pub.
          * [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          **May 15th - 20th**

          * [Evenings] Catch up with friends individually or in smaller groups, perhaps for dinners, walks, or other social activities.

          **May 21st**

          * [Evening] Organize a game night at her home, inviting Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob.

          **May 22nd - 27th**

          * [Weekdays] Continue with regular routines, but make time for small moments of enjoyment, like reading a book, listening to music, or taking a relaxing bath.

          **May 28th**

          * [Daytime] Plan a day trip to a nearby town or attraction with friends.

          **May 29th - 31st**

          * [Evenings] Enjoy relaxed evenings at home, perhaps watching movies, playing board games, or simply catching up with loved ones.

          This plan allows for a balance of socializing, relaxation, and fun activities, all while keeping Alice Lewis's goal of having a good time at the forefront.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer:

          Relevant memories:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she convinced her entire class that she had a secret admirer who left her love notes written in invisible ink. She even provided "evidence" by "discovering" the notes under her desk, written with lemon juice and revealed by heat from a light bulb. The attention she received, the whispers and curious glances, fueled a thrill within her that she had never experienced before.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20 years old, she persuaded her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, to accompany her on a "secret mission" to The Crooked Billet. She claimed to have insider information about a rare, limited-edition beer being released that night. The bar staff, in on the ruse, played along, adding to the excitement. Alice reveled in the feeling of being the orchestrator of such a special experience for her friends, even though the beer was simply a regular ale with a fancy name she had invented.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.

          The current time is: [14 May 2015 10:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Alice Lewis change their current plan?
          (a) Yes
          (b) No
          Answer: (b)
          Question: Write Alice Lewis's plan for The rest of the month, focusing on the medium term. Provide a detailed schedule, keep in mind the goal. Please format the plan like in this example: [21:00 - 22:00] watch TV
          Answer: Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 14th (Today)**

          * [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.
          * [17:00 - 18:00] Travel to The Crooked Billet pub.
          * [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          **May 15th - 20th**

          * [Evenings] Catch up with friends individually or in smaller groups, perhaps for dinners, walks, or other social activities.

          **May 21st**

          * [Evening] Organize a game night at her home, inviting Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob.

          **May 22nd - 27th**

          * [Weekdays] Continue with regular routines, but make time for small moments of enjoyment, like reading a book, listening to music, or taking a relaxing bath.

          **May 28th**

          * [Daytime] Plan a day trip to a nearby town or attraction with friends.

          **May 29th - 31st**

          * [Evenings] Enjoy relaxed evenings at home, perhaps watching movies, playing board games, or simply catching up with loved ones.

          This plan allows for a balance of socializing, relaxation, and fun activities, all while keeping Alice Lewis's goal of having a good time at the forefront.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely be suggesting a pub for the group to watch the game, perhaps even The Crooked Billet, her favorite.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she convinced her entire class that she had a secret admirer who left her love notes written in invisible ink. She even provided "evidence" by "discovering" the notes under her desk, written with lemon juice and revealed by heat from a light bulb. The attention she received, the whispers and curious glances, fueled a thrill within her that she had never experienced before.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20 years old, she persuaded her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, to accompany her on a "secret mission" to The Crooked Billet. She claimed to have insider information about a rare, limited-edition beer being released that night. The bar staff, in on the ruse, played along, adding to the excitement. Alice reveled in the feeling of being the orchestrator of such a special experience for her friends, even though the beer was simply a regular ale with a fancy name she had invented.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:The staff are knowledgeable about their drinks and always happy to recommend something new.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and imaginative person who enjoys bringing people together.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before heading to a pub to watch a football game later that evening.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be suggesting a pub for the group to watch the game, perhaps even The Crooked Billet, her favorite.

        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and imaginative person who enjoys bringing people together.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she convinced her entire class that she had a secret admirer who left her love notes written in invisible ink. She even provided "evidence" by "discovering" the notes under her desk, written with lemon juice and revealed by heat from a light bulb. The attention she received, the whispers and curious glances, fueled a thrill within her that she had never experienced before.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20 years old, she persuaded her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, to accompany her on a "secret mission" to The Crooked Billet. She claimed to have insider information about a rare, limited-edition beer being released that night. The bar staff, in on the ruse, played along, adding to the excitement. Alice reveled in the feeling of being the orchestrator of such a special experience for her friends, even though the beer was simply a regular ale with a fancy name she had invented.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:The staff are knowledgeable about their drinks and always happy to recommend something new.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          current daily occupation: likely trying to convince her friends to watch the game at The Crooked Billet.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and imaginative person who enjoys bringing people together.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before heading to a pub to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be suggesting a pub for the group to watch the game, perhaps even The Crooked Billet, her favorite.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 14th (Today)**

          * [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.
          * [17:00 - 18:00] Travel to The Crooked Billet pub.
          * [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          **May 15th - 20th**

          * [Evenings] Catch up with friends individually or in smaller groups, perhaps for dinners, walks, or other social activities.

          **May 21st**

          * [Evening] Organize a game night at her home, inviting Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob.

          **May 22nd - 27th**

          * [Weekdays] Continue with regular routines, but make time for small moments of enjoyment, like reading a book, listening to music, or taking a relaxing bath.

          **May 28th**

          * [Daytime] Plan a day trip to a nearby town or attraction with friends.

          **May 29th - 31st**

          * [Evenings] Enjoy relaxed evenings at home, perhaps watching movies, playing board games, or simply catching up with loved ones.

          This plan allows for a balance of socializing, relaxation, and fun activities, all while keeping Alice Lewis's goal of having a good time at the forefront.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]

William had practiced diligently, but his shyness prevented him from trying out, leaving him with a bitter taste of inadequacy. He retreated to The Black Swan, finding solace in the music but unable to shake the feeling of being left behind.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Active player

      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.

          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 14th (Tonight):**

          * [18:00 - 19:00] Head to The Black Swan with friends.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Enjoy pre-game drinks and snacks at The Black Swan.
          * [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan.
          * [23:00 - 00:00] Post-game drinks and conversation at The Black Swan.

          **May 15th - 20th:**

          * Continue to enjoy time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they enjoy together.

          **May 21st:**

          * [Evening] Host a casual dinner party at his place for friends.

          **May 22nd - 27th:**

          * Spend time pursuing hobbies, reading, writing, or exploring new interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [Afternoon] Visit a local museum or art gallery with friends.
          * [Evening] Attend a live music performance.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Relax and recharge, perhaps taking a day trip outside the city or simply enjoying quiet time at home.


          This plan balances socializing with friends, pursuing personal interests, and allowing for spontaneity and flexibility.

          Jack Taylor's

          Relevant memories:
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he walked into The Black Swan for the first time, drawn in by the warm glow of lamplight spilling onto the cobblestone street and the muffled sounds of a bluesy melody. He immediately felt a sense of belonging, a feeling that had eluded him in the sterile confines of his wealthy upbringing. He spent the evening listening to the band, sipping on a dark ale, and observing the regulars, absorbing the atmosphere and weaving narratives about their lives in his mind. This became his sanctuary, a place where he could shed his carefully constructed mask and simply be Jack, a master storyteller lost in the music and the murmured conversations.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.

          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he walked into The Black Swan for the first time, drawn in by the warm glow of lamplight spilling onto the cobblestone street and the muffled sounds of a bluesy melody. He immediately felt a sense of belonging, a feeling that had eluded him in the sterile confines of his wealthy upbringing. He spent the evening listening to the band, sipping on a dark ale, and observing the regulars, absorbing the atmosphere and weaving narratives about their lives in his mind. This became his sanctuary, a place where he could shed his carefully constructed mask and simply be Jack, a master storyteller lost in the music and the murmured conversations.

          Answer: Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 14th (Tonight):**

          * [18:00 - 19:00] Head to The Black Swan with friends.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Enjoy pre-game drinks and snacks at The Black Swan.
          * [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan.
          * [23:00 - 00:00] Post-game drinks and conversation at The Black Swan.

          **May 15th - 20th:**

          * Continue to enjoy time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they enjoy together.

          **May 21st:**

          * [Evening] Host a casual dinner party at his place for friends.

          **May 22nd - 27th:**

          * Spend time pursuing hobbies, reading, writing, or exploring new interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [Afternoon] Visit a local museum or art gallery with friends.
          * [Evening] Attend a live music performance.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Relax and recharge, perhaps taking a day trip outside the city or simply enjoying quiet time at home.


          This plan balances socializing with friends, pursuing personal interests, and allowing for spontaneity and flexibility.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, that he had discovered a secret treasure map leading to buried pirate gold in the woods behind their school. For weeks, they followed his elaborate clues, digging holes and deciphering riddles, fueled by Jack's captivating storytelling and the promise of untold riches. In reality, Jack had simply made the whole thing up, reveling in the power he held over his friends' imaginations and the thrill of orchestrating such a grand deception.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he walked into The Black Swan for the first time, drawn in by the warm glow of lamplight spilling onto the cobblestone street and the muffled sounds of a bluesy melody. He immediately felt a sense of belonging, a feeling that had eluded him in the sterile confines of his wealthy upbringing. He spent the evening listening to the band, sipping on a dark ale, and observing the regulars, absorbing the atmosphere and weaving narratives about their lives in his mind. This became his sanctuary, a place where he could shed his carefully constructed mask and simply be Jack, a master storyteller lost in the music and the murmured conversations.

          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, that he had discovered a secret treasure map leading to buried pirate gold in the woods behind their school. For weeks, they followed his elaborate clues, digging holes and deciphering riddles, fueled by Jack's captivating storytelling and the promise of untold riches.           [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he walked into The Black Swan for the first time, drawn in by the warm glow of lamplight spilling onto the cobblestone street and the muffled sounds of a bluesy melody. He spent the evening listening to the band, sipping on a dark ale, and observing the regulars, absorbing the atmosphere and weaving narratives about their lives in his mind. This became his sanctuary, a place where he could shed his carefully constructed mask and simply be Jack, a master storyteller lost in the music and the murmured conversations.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely watching the European football cup game with his friends at The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and hopeful.
          core characteristics: a charismatic and imaginative individual with a penchant for storytelling and a desire for connection. He enjoys creating elaborate narratives, as evidenced by his childhood treasure hunt, and seeks out environments where he can feel a sense of belonging, such as The Black Swan pub. He values friendship and shared experiences, preferring to watch football games with his close-knit group of friends. He is also a working-class man who appreciates simple pleasures like good beer, lively conversation, and the camaraderie of his peers.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a charismatic and imaginative storyteller who values friendship and connection.

        • current daily occupation: likely watching the European football cup game with his friends at The Black Swan.

          core characteristics: a charismatic and imaginative individual with a penchant for storytelling and a desire for connection. He enjoys creating elaborate narratives, as evidenced by his childhood treasure hunt, and seeks out environments where he can feel a sense of belonging, such as The Black Swan pub. He values friendship and shared experiences, preferring to watch football games with his close-knit group of friends. He is also a working-class man who appreciates simple pleasures like good beer, lively conversation, and the camaraderie of his peers.

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?

          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends before heading to watch a football game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, that he had discovered a secret treasure map leading to buried pirate gold in the woods behind their school. For weeks, they followed his elaborate clues, digging holes and deciphering riddles, fueled by Jack's captivating storytelling and the promise of untold riches. In reality, Jack had simply made the whole thing up, reveling in the power he held over his friends' imaginations and the thrill of orchestrating such a grand deception.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he walked into The Black Swan for the first time, drawn in by the warm glow of lamplight spilling onto the cobblestone street and the muffled sounds of a bluesy melody. He immediately felt a sense of belonging, a feeling that had eluded him in the sterile confines of his wealthy upbringing. He spent the evening listening to the band, sipping on a dark ale, and observing the regulars, absorbing the atmosphere and weaving narratives about their lives in his mind. This became his sanctuary, a place where he could shed his carefully constructed mask and simply be Jack, a master storyteller lost in the music and the murmured conversations.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
