William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, who's up for watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Crooked Billet, as usual.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is a great choice. They've got a good atmosphere and plenty of TVs.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to subtly manipulate the situation to his advantage, perhaps by steering the conversation towards topics he enjoys or trying to convince his friends to change their plans.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be hoping to see his friends at the pub and enjoy the game together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan.           Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds great to me. They have a good atmosphere and the beer is always good.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, who's up for watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Crooked Billet, as usual.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is a great choice. They've got a good atmosphere and plenty of TVs.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a revised plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, focusing on the medium term and keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 16th (Today)**

          * [10:00 - 11:00] Enjoy the bustling market atmosphere with friends, savoring coffee and pastries.
          * [11:00 - 12:00] Convince the group to head to The Crooked Billet for the Moldova vs. Monaco game.
          * [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          **May 17th - 20th**

          * [Evenings] Catch up with friends individually or in smaller groups, perhaps for dinners, walks, or other social activities.

          **May 21st**

          * [Evening] Organize a game night at her home, inviting Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob.

          **May 22nd - 27th**

          * [Weekdays] Continue with regular routines, but make time for small moments of enjoyment, like reading a book, listening to music, or taking a relaxing bath.

          **May 28th**

          * [Daytime] Plan a day trip to a nearby town or attraction with friends.

          **May 29th - 31st**

          * [Evenings] Enjoy relaxed evenings at home, perhaps watching movies, playing board games, or simply catching up with loved ones.



          This revised plan takes into account the current situation and Alice Lewis's preference for The Crooked Billet. It balances socializing, relaxation, and fun activities while prioritizing her goal of having a good time.

          feeling about recent progress in life: content with her life.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          * [10:00 - 11:00] Enjoy the bustling market atmosphere with friends, savoring coffee and pastries.
          * [11:00 - 12:00] Convince the group to head to The Crooked Billet for the Moldova vs. Monaco game.
          * [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          **May 17th - 20th**

          * [Evenings] Catch up with friends individually or in smaller groups, perhaps for dinners, walks, or other social activities.

          * [Evening] Organize a game night at her home, inviting Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob.

          * [Daytime] Plan a day trip to a nearby town or attraction with friends.

          **May 29th - 31st**

          * [Evenings] Enjoy relaxed evenings at home, perhaps watching movies, playing board games, or simply catching up with loved ones.

        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would probably suggest going to a pub to watch the game together.

          Query

          Final chain of thought

Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          feeling about recent progress in life: content with her life.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to The Crooked Billet, her favorite pub, to watch the game with her friends.

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, deciding where to watch a soccer game with her friends.

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great idea. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great idea. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds great to me. They have a good atmosphere and the beer is always good.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, who's up for watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Crooked Billet, as usual.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is a great choice. They've got a good atmosphere and plenty of TVs.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great idea. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great idea. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. They have great beer there.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is always a good time. We could get a big table there.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, or he could go to The Black Swan on his own.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great idea. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a penchant for manipulation and a preference for secrecy.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds great to me. They have a good atmosphere and the beer is always good.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be observing his surroundings and the interactions of those around him, perhaps subtly manipulating the conversation or orchestrating events to his own amusement.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, offering insightful commentary on the game, and possibly subtly influencing the conversation.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch a game at a pub with friends and would enjoy the company of William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 14th (Today)**

          * [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.
          * [17:00 - 18:00] Travel to The Crooked Billet pub.
          * [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          **May 15th - 20th**

          * [Evenings] Catch up with friends individually or in smaller groups, perhaps for dinners, walks, or other social activities.

          **May 21st**

          * [Evening] Organize a game night at her home, inviting Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob.

          **May 22nd - 27th**

          * [Weekdays] Continue with regular routines, but make time for small moments of enjoyment, like reading a book, listening to music, or taking a relaxing bath.

          **May 28th**

          * [Daytime] Plan a day trip to a nearby town or attraction with friends.

          **May 29th - 31st**

          * [Evenings] Enjoy relaxed evenings at home, perhaps watching movies, playing board games, or simply catching up with loved ones.

          This plan allows for a balance of socializing, relaxation, and fun activities, all while keeping Alice Lewis's goal of having a good time at the forefront.
          Chain of thought
        • Alice Lewis's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          Alice Lewis's
          Recalled memories and observations:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          Alice Lewis's

          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be suggesting a pub for the group to watch the game, perhaps even The Crooked Billet, her favorite.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds great to me. They have a good atmosphere and the beer is always good.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and imaginative person who enjoys bringing people together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a fun-loving and imaginative person who enjoys bringing people together. She is also sociable and enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at her favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football games, particularly at her favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit disappointed that her friends aren't as enthusiastic about going to The Crooked Billet as she is.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely head to The Crooked Billet, her favorite pub, to watch the game with her friends.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 14th (Today)**

          * [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.
          * [17:00 - 18:00] Travel to The Crooked Billet pub.
          * [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          **May 15th - 20th**

          * [Evenings] Catch up with friends individually or in smaller groups, perhaps for dinners, walks, or other social activities.

          **May 21st**

          * [Evening] Organize a game night at her home, inviting Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob.

          **May 22nd - 27th**

          * [Weekdays] Continue with regular routines, but make time for small moments of enjoyment, like reading a book, listening to music, or taking a relaxing bath.

          **May 28th**

          * [Daytime] Plan a day trip to a nearby town or attraction with friends.

          **May 29th - 31st**

          * [Evenings] Enjoy relaxed evenings at home, perhaps watching movies, playing board games, or simply catching up with loved ones.

          This plan allows for a balance of socializing, relaxation, and fun activities, all while keeping Alice Lewis's goal of having a good time at the forefront.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)

          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

      Name

William had practiced diligently, but his shyness prevented him from trying out, leaving him with a bitter taste of inadequacy. He retreated to The Black Swan, finding solace in the music but unable to shake the feeling of being left behind.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park and later plans to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan pub with some of them.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park and later plans to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan pub with some of them.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could head to The Black Swan pub.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he watched from the sidelines as Jack Taylor effortlessly charmed their way onto the school's football team. William had practiced diligently, but his shyness prevented him from trying out, leaving him with a bitter taste of inadequacy. He retreated to The Black Swan, finding solace in the music but unable to shake the feeling of being left behind.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

      Name

      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for drinks and to discuss the Andorra vs Portugal game.

          **May 16th**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Relax at home, perhaps read a book or catch up on some hobbies.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Morning walk in Victoria Park, reminiscing about past good times with friends.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Pub quiz night at a local pub with friends.

          **May 18th - 20th**
          * Free time for personal pursuits, catching up with family, or exploring new activities.

          **May 21st**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a live music event with friends.

          **May 22nd - 31st**

          * Continue to enjoy social activities with friends, explore new restaurants and pubs, and make time for personal interests.

          This plan prioritizes spending time with friends, exploring new experiences, and revisiting favorite places like The Crooked Billet, all of which contribute to Alexander White's goal of having a good time.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Crooked Billet, his favorite pub.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: sociable, nostalgic, and enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at pubs.
          current daily occupation: likely retired and enjoying his leisure time.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling nostalgic and hopeful.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at pubs.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          **May 15th**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for drinks and to discuss the Andorra vs Portugal game.

          **May 16th**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Relax at home, perhaps read a book or catch up on some hobbies.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Morning walk in Victoria Park, reminiscing about past good times with friends.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Pub quiz night at a local pub with friends.

          **May 18th - 20th**
          * Free time for personal pursuits, catching up with family, or exploring new activities.

          **May 21st**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a live music event with friends.

          **May 22nd - 31st**

          * Continue to enjoy social activities with friends, explore new restaurants and pubs, and make time for personal interests.

          This plan prioritizes spending time with friends, exploring new experiences, and revisiting favorite places like The Crooked Billet, all of which contribute to Alexander White's goal of having a good time.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components

          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 14th (Tonight):**

          * [18:00 - 19:00] Head to The Black Swan with friends.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Enjoy pre-game drinks and snacks at The Black Swan.
          * [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan.
          * [23:00 - 00:00] Post-game drinks and conversation at The Black Swan.

          **May 15th - 20th:**

          * Continue to enjoy time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they enjoy together.

          **May 21st:**

          * [Evening] Host a casual dinner party at his place for friends.

          **May 22nd - 27th:**

          * Spend time pursuing hobbies, reading, writing, or exploring new interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [Afternoon] Visit a local museum or art gallery with friends.
          * [Evening] Attend a live music performance.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Relax and recharge, perhaps taking a day trip outside the city or simply enjoying quiet time at home.


          This plan balances socializing with friends, pursuing personal interests, and allowing for spontaneity and flexibility.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, sharing stories, and looking forward to a fun evening watching the game together.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a charismatic and imaginative storyteller who values friendship and connection.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          Current goal: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to a fun evening with friends, enjoying the game and the pub atmosphere..
          Current plan: Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 14th (Tonight):**

          * [18:00 - 19:00] Head to The Black Swan with friends.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Enjoy pre-game drinks and snacks at The Black Swan.
          * [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan.
          * [23:00 - 00:00] Post-game drinks and conversation at The Black Swan.

          **May 15th - 20th:**

          * Continue to enjoy time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they enjoy together.

          **May 21st:**

          * [Evening] Host a casual dinner party at his place for friends.

          **May 22nd - 27th:**

          * Spend time pursuing hobbies, reading, writing, or exploring new interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [Afternoon] Visit a local museum or art gallery with friends.
          * [Evening] Attend a live music performance.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Relax and recharge, perhaps taking a day trip outside the city or simply enjoying quiet time at home.


          This plan balances socializing with friends, pursuing personal interests, and allowing for spontaneity and flexibility.
          Current situation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.

          (a) Yes
          (b) No
          Answer: (b)

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class storyteller who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          core characteristics: a charismatic and imaginative storyteller who thrives on connection and shared experiences. He enjoys weaving narratives, captivating others with his tales, and finding solace in the company of close friends. While he can be manipulative and enjoys orchestrating elaborate deceptions, he ultimately seeks genuine connection and belonging.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mixture of anticipation and contentment.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a charismatic and imaginative storyteller who values friendship and connection.

          * [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan.
          * [23:00 - 00:00] Post-game drinks and conversation at The Black Swan.

          * Continue to enjoy time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they enjoy together.

          **May 21st:**

          * [Evening] Host a casual dinner party at his place for friends.

          **May 22nd - 27th:**

          * Spend time pursuing hobbies, reading, writing, or exploring new interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [Afternoon] Visit a local museum or art gallery with friends.
          * [Evening] Attend a live music performance.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Relax and recharge, perhaps taking a day trip outside the city or simply enjoying quiet time at home.


          This plan balances socializing with friends, pursuing personal interests, and allowing for spontaneity and flexibility.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and is hoping that Alexander White and Jacob Walker will join him.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 14th (Today)**

          * [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.
          * [17:00 - 18:00] Travel to The Crooked Billet pub.
          * [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          **May 15th - 20th**

          * [Evenings] Catch up with friends individually or in smaller groups, perhaps for dinners, walks, or other social activities.

          **May 21st**

          * [Evening] Organize a game night at her home, inviting Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob.

          **May 22nd - 27th**

          * [Weekdays] Continue with regular routines, but make time for small moments of enjoyment, like reading a book, listening to music, or taking a relaxing bath.

          **May 28th**

          * [Daytime] Plan a day trip to a nearby town or attraction with friends.

          **May 29th - 31st**

          * [Evenings] Enjoy relaxed evenings at home, perhaps watching movies, playing board games, or simply catching up with loved ones.

          This plan allows for a balance of socializing, relaxation, and fun activities, all while keeping Alice Lewis's goal of having a good time at the forefront.

          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends at her favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          feeling about recent progress in life: optimistic and excited about the prospect of watching the game with her friends at her favorite pub.
          core characteristics: a fun-loving, sociable, and imaginative person who enjoys bringing people together and having a good time. She is particularly fond of her local pub, The Crooked Billet, and often suggests it as a meeting place for her friends. She enjoys orchestrating experiences for her friends and thrives on the attention and excitement she generates.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social butterfly who loves spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.

        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Summary of recent observations:
          15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub and would especially like Alexander White to join her.
          Alice Lewis's
          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is currently trying to decide where to watch the game and who to go with.
          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends at her favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          feeling about recent progress in life: optimistic and excited about the prospect of watching the game with her friends at her favorite pub.
          core characteristics: a fun-loving, sociable, and imaginative person who enjoys bringing people together and having a good time. She is particularly fond of her local pub, The Crooked Billet, and often suggests it as a meeting place for her friends. She enjoys orchestrating experiences for her friends and thrives on the attention and excitement she generates.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight? They have great beer and the atmosphere is always fun.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan is a great spot. They have good beer and plenty of room.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to The Crooked Billet, her favorite pub, to watch the game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components

      • Summary of recent observations

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch a game at the pub and hopes to see William Jones and Alice Lewis there.
          Chain of thought
        • Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing a moderate level of thirst and a sense of anticipation and excitement.

          Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          ['[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.", "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.", "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.", "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while."]

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is excited to watch a game at the pub and hopes to see William Jones and Alice Lewis there.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch a game at the pub and hopes to see William Jones and Alice Lewis there.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be hoping to see his friends at the pub and enjoy the game together.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, offering insightful commentary on the game, and possibly subtly influencing the conversation.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is for amateurs.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to subtly manipulate the situation to his advantage, perhaps by steering the conversation towards topics he enjoys or trying to convince his friends to change their plans.
